WRITING.TITLE: Let's achieve a power greater than any meme on r/Place. For the Senate

WRITING.TEXT: They are very hard to kill
I have one less then a mile away and I see more movies there than at regular theatres.

That is what I meant by fluke, it hit at the right time. If you look at the sales, each Nintendo console sells less than the last one, except for maybe the virtual boy and Wii. I think the Switch will handily beat the Wii U, and its success is not based around being a home console but rather an extremely good handheld. They probably wont get Triple A console games, but if it gets a price drop and gets sequels to games that were on the 3ds, it should do fine.
These people fail to realise that most people buy dvds which are only 480p.

Some people may see the Switch as releasing a few years after everything else, I see it as releasing a few years before Playstation 5 and Xbox 2, kinda like Dreamcast and Wii U. I also see the Wii as mainly a fluke, it appealed to a casual market that has been greatly diminished by phones and tablets in the last few years. There are going to be many huge games that Switch will be missing such as Elder Scrolls 6, Red Dead 2, Prey, Shadow of War, Battlefront, Assassins Creed, and Call of Duty which could definitly hurt perception and sales.

But, it still had enough power to play games that Gamecube and Xbox had, and also was an inexpensive DVD player. For example, Prince of Persia the Sands of Time came out on all three consoles, while I doubt Battlefront 2 will be released for the Switch.
This actually is a misconception, even though ps2 was less powerfull is still got basically every triple A 3rd party game.
/uj when did this hatred for 720p even start, 720p still looks really good.
Or you could just hide her on a different earth.
ok thanks for the info
/uj For some reason everyone expects Avatar 2 to make no money, even though this is the guy that made Titanic and Avatar.
